Can I say Ark is a good survival crafting game? Not really. And that's not the fault of the current team. The elephant in the room is that early development on this game was absolute dogshit. With later staff coming in with fresh ideas, and more programming experience with making video games...they have made a genuine effort to make this game work. The controls are clunky, especially on the Tek Armor (I frequently make the joke about I don't wear Tek boots, I just stick my feet in sticks of butter.). Hitboxes are janky, snap points on buildings are an actual nightmare as someone who loves doing mega bases in their free time on pve, and not to mention that this game could probably still assassinate your motherboard if it looked at you funny. 

   Can I say Ark is a fun sandbox to just mess around in? ...Actually, yeah. Despite all the problems, it's goofy and fun. I once spent weeks slowly breeding Equus to see how much damage I could stack, and eventually one shot the broodmother with it. Why? I just wanted to see what would happen. This is a game where you could go in to it two ways. Playing it like your standard survival crafting game, or...just letting your inner kid appreciate the fact that you're riding on a candy raver colored Rex, dressed in a top hat and Hawaiian shirt with no pants on, wielding a flamethrower and fighting a dragon. Embrace the madness, and you'll have fun.

   Honestly, with what I have seen the developers doing ...I can see ARK 2 being a solid title for anyones collection. I just hope they don't forget what made me want to play this game. ...Which is playing Pokemon but with Dinosaurs and frighteningly uncomfortable platypus hellspawn that sprays milk like it's a childrens waterpark feature.

I wanted to give this game a try again after taking a long break from it. My experience follows:

- Not much has changed since my previous attempt at playing this. Even with the paid expansions, game is just as crappy as I remember it being.
- The community is just as bad as CSGO.
- Poorly optimized even after all these years of being out. There's no way in hell my computer's frame rate should be tanking. Specs below. This is absurd.
- Some of the dumbest mechanics ever. There's no reason why I should have to unequip a tool just to grab something off the ground. (This might be me being nit-picky but why is this even there?)
+ Sounds are great.
+ Taming Dinosaurs is fun.

Ryzen 5 3600XT 6-Core 3.8Ghz
AMD Radeon RX 6600 8gb VRAM
And 32gb of RAM.

I have played a lot of this game over the years going back to when I played it on xbox. Every single time that something bad has happened in the game it was never due to an enemy fairly beating me. This game is about offline-ing people, insiding them, cheating..(look those words up if you don't know) The game itself is great, build a base, tame dinos, grind resources, craft a bunch of different stuff, defeat a number of different bosses. It's honestly very fun and if you have friends then it's even better. Work with them, build with them, fight with them. But eventually something will go horribly wrong, meshing and undermapping and other words I used to not understand very well will become words your very familiar with. All of a sudden an enemy is in your base wrecking you, all of a sudden someone whistles your tames into the water to drown them, all of a sudden all your hard work is ruined by someone that didn't even have the balls to fight you head on. Also, get used to mega tribes. They want you to be their slaves for resources and wont take no for an answer. These No Life Gamers will absolutely spend their time tracking you, following you, and ultimately screwing you over. They have no issues with using resources gained over years playing the game to wipe a base built over only a few weeks or months. Using, for example, a huge OP Mek(looks like a transformer) to completely demolish all you have just for the giggles. 

So the game itself I give a 9/10. I wouldn't come back as many times as I have if it were not fun, but the community is a bit rough. Do not trust anyone, do not let people into your tribe if you don't know them. Do not let anyone know your base location, defend what you have immediately and hide anything valuable. People will screw you over, trust me. And if you didn't know.. change your steam profile name to 123. It adds anonymity to your profile and makes it tougher for those that use battlemetrics to follow your account. If they have a grudge with you believe me that these no life turds will follow you around maps and servers just to punish you.

And because of this widdled down, only the bobs and no lifers left community, I give the game a 4/10. They say it is better to have loved and lost than to have never loved at all.

I know, it's a semi-finished survival game, it's not supposed to be perfect but good god this thing is so broken.  Creatures clip through walls and then get stuck in them (so do players), tamed dinos fall through the map never to be seen again, following AI is entirely busted, hitboxes - yeah, we've heard of them.  And so on and so on and so on.  Couple that with no QoL features to address these issues and I'm done with it.  Of course a feature to teleport my favourite dino back to me after the game decided to drop it into the abyss would break immersion.  Like the bugs that made me want that feature don't.  I've played lots of buggy early access survival games but there's a limit to how much I'm prepared to put up with and this exceeds it.

First i will start by saying i am a pve player.

if you try to play this game on "Official" servers you will have a bad time. thats all i will say about the matter.

unofficial is where it is at. this game is best played with friends, there is much advernture, a steep learning curve, and plenty of things that will get you screaming. 

this game is where the survival genre started, harvesting, building, eating tameing.

when you first log on, you may find yourself being killed repeatedly, by weather, by little angry dino's, but dont get disheartened, most people start this way, the game is well worth sticking to.

there is much hidden lore and a wealth of things to do. go from a naked caveman to iron man flying through the sky shooting lasers and piloting giant battle meks. 
playing in scorched desert worlds worying about heat stroke and where to get your next drink. stealing eggs from dragons nest. surviving in a broken world where the creatures of the deep want you for lunch and the sun wants to vaporise you. building massive treehouses on the giant redwoods, growing vegetables and tameing all dinosaurs big and small.

i have played this game out, so it no longer holds much excitement for me. however there are many good memories and nostalgia for me in this game, i dont regret the many hours i have played it.

i invite anyone to try this game, just dont go official. if i were to give you some tips for this game, 

Dont overlook food and kibble, it can make your game much easyer
Dont overlook fishing, all of my best loot came from it
Spend some time on/underwater, some of the caves make fantastic hidden bases. building a portable base on a raft is so useful. or even better, building your home on the back of a massive underwater dino. or building your base on the back of a giant flying dino is fun too

Played on both PC and Playstation.
For a survivalist gamer, ARK properly reaches those itchy spots that you will want. It's learning curve can be steep, but once you understand the flow of technology and get in a few videos from content creaters (*cough*Pterafier*cough*) you will have a somewhat comfortable time leveling up. Ironically, the way the game is set up many players say they enjoy even the experience of starting fresh more then any other community I've seen.

First thing I would recommend is any creators video on setting up the game's settings. This can be an extremely big difference in how you play the game  but yea there are some very big QoL sliders. Some let you shorten the Night/Day time, let you focus  less on gathering,  effect breeding, and more. I personally increase the gathering strength and the amount nodes have (you can adjust how quickly and  how close to your buildings they can respawn) if in solo. Many PvP and PvE servers will have their own settings to allow for their particular flow of game play. 

Dinos, Dinos, Dinos..
Yes, they are everywhere, along with much more as you will soon be murdered b... I mean come across in epic discovery fashion. Watch how majestic and effortlessly a pack of Raptors cover the ground towards their prey (you.). Nothing like the sight of a rare and beautifully colored Spinosaurus basking in the midday sun (also coming for you). Hear the proudness in the voice of the T Rex as he tells you how happy he is to claim this side of the mountain his home (and why the hell are you in it?). Still, they are the  key to both survival and progression. This games first step into it's deep cold waters starts with probably a Parasaur. Almost every sentient being you come across can be tamed. They are all unique, and all hold a purpose. Parasaurs can hold weight and move about whatever map you're on fast enough to outrun a majority of the beginning opposition (They can also gather Narco berries faster then you, but not as good as a Trike.) They come in many colors, and one day you might even come across versions of certain dinos that will make your jaw drop. They have random colors on set pallets, but events and breeding can produce some very unique companions. (Don't get attached. Food chain is real.) Three horns do indeed play with long necks. You will need many dinos to make the game comfortable. Ground runners (Parasaur, Equuis, Iguanadons), attack and defense (Raptors, Stegos, T Rex), workers (Dodas and Ankys), flyers (Ptredons, Argys,) and even aquatic life (yea... Megaladons and Sarcos.. but you have to tame them to appreciate them. Until then it's them appreciating you). Every dino has a use, just gotta learn how to catch them (we got Pokeballs.. kinda. But you won't see them for a good while. Until then remember Ash never had to worry about being gutted for dinner. You do, and you got a pointy stick)

Building Bedrock:
The building system is best left to content creators to explain and demonstrate. You can do some interesting things with placement and item used to produce some beautiful structures. But honestly if your reading this and you're about to experience this game for the first time, you will find yourself huddled in the dark in a 2x2 (or smaller) straw thatch house with no head room and dino walking right outside your tiki hut, waiting for daylight You will soon graduate in Minecraft fashion as you level to Wood, then stone, and then metal. Not gonna spoil what progression is there, but it's there and will surprise you. Base characters will not have enough points to buy every engram upgrade. Some people will create a Builder character, a smitthy, or a combat oriented build so this has impact in what you unlock. The games building allows for some good creativity though, and you should be able to have a nice home to place for your dinos. My personal style I enjoy the leveling and let the primitive/stone go enough to enjoy building a few locations before I out-level into metal tier. But upgrading beyond stone increase the damage it can take so in many situations stone and wood is just fine (and twice as good looking). I prefer to getting to level 16, then building a wood raft. At first when you see the raft you will fell like taking to the oceans. Ironically the canou and the raft have almost opposite usages as intended, but I won't spoil any surprises. Just remember... food chain and never become attached to anything. But seriously.. the raft. Go watch a video on house boats. 

War. It never ends, and neither does the fight to be top of the food chain. Be it PvE cave runs with your tribe, PvP wars between tribes for positional domination, or simply surviving solo on an island where everything wants to kill you, a torch will not be enough. Guns and Dinos. I love Murder Chickens and Shotguns and so will you probably. Be ready for your first PvP server experience. Most servers will have a Welcome Committee on Ptradons who will gladly help you reach new heights :) Welcome to the ARK. Not only can you fight outright, ARK holds some interesting options. Like sedating your targets (human too) and putting them in shackles. They won't be able to visually see during, so feel free to thrown them in a previously dug pit and fill it with human and dino feces. ASSERT DOMINANC... I mean come to a mutually respected understanding that this is where you like to bring your Sarco's to sunbathe and they might have a better experience on another beach. On the other side of the map.

Graphics are good, each map is atmospheric and unique to it's own. Sound is on par. 

Content and DLC:
You don't need paid DLC, but the do give unique tames and equpiment. You can check the wiki and normal spots to find locations and on which maps tames spawn on. Some paid DLC tamesare in the 6 free maps. And those free maps likewise has unique tames. I personally enjoyed the challanges from Scorched Earth and Arbitration, but Genesis 1 and 2 I didn't like and felt to linear and out of place with ARK as a whole.

Cons:
There are a log of bugs as with any game that uses physics and AI. Be careful and do a bit of research. I've lost a few dinos and such to crashes. The game doesn't hold you hand either, so personal effort will be needed to learn everything. I prefer that, some don't. I personally haven't experience anything gamebreaking though, and this game has been out a while so it's received many updates. Though rightfully so,  vets of the community can point out some vaild issues still waiting patching. Otherwise it's been a great experience and place to sink some of my time into
All it's missing is cadillacs; otherwise, it's perfect fun.

While the game could certainly use improvements it dose provide many hours of entertainment for those into open world base building games. Note: It is very important to adjust the game settings if you are playing solo as the default settings assume group play and will be extremely brutal to a new solo players.

I absolutely loved hosting modded private PVE servers for my friends and family.  The dinos and interactions with them are extremely fun.  Base building is fun.  Raft building is fun.  Exploring the oceans is fun. Crafting is fun.  Exploring ruins and caves is fun. Running from giant angry dinos is fun.  Beautiful art and huge maps.....

The official servers?  Lets just say I had to ban anyone that tried to bring that attitude to my server.  Toxic doesn't even begin to describe the mental illness that grows there thanks to the lack of abuse mitigation.  It's a completely different experience tailored for exploitation and devoid of kindness.

I would never recommend this game in it's official state.

I give it a thumbs up for my WONDERFUL experience exploring the maps, and building/crafting with friends and family that didn't want to kill others or exploit nature.

This game is not an easy one to review. I have a great deal of time in this game, more than any other game. Around 5000 hours on pc between steam and epic, 7000 hours on  Windows. 

That being said it is not a game worth getting into at this point. I cannot recommend this game in its current state nor the state its been in the last two years. It has one of the most toxic communities that goes out of their way to bully anyone and everyone.

There is so much cheating that goes unpunished, in the rare case someone is banned its barely a slap on the wrist. Accounts with all DLCs are often bought for well under 10 dollars. The duplication of items has created a massive RMT market that has over saturated the game with end game structures and gear. Aimbot or as it is referred to in this community "spinning" is a plague that affects every official and dedi server. Meshing, where players put themselves outside of the normal playable areas to by bass your defences. What this means is the bases you have potentially spent 10s, 100s or even 1000s of hours into can be raided from the inside out. The final cheating method worth mentioning here is account spoofing. So many tribes with 100s of players have lost their servers as of late due to this. Accounts can be hacked by discord spam bots sending malicious links to players to retrieve sign in information among other things.

This was once a one of a kind clunky masterpiece of a game that thousands of players once loved to hate. In 2022 though it is a far cry of what it once was.

I got this game on a free weekend event but didnt have the GB to play it. I finally freed up some space to play it and downloaded it. The first 10 or so hours were amazing! It was fun to play and taming dinos was super cool. However when I brought along my Pteranodon, Parasaurolophus, Stegosaurus and Triceratops on an expedition to find new dinos and stuff I got lost. No big deal I had a compass and the map but right about when I think I found my home I hopped off my Parasaurolophus and before I know it ALL MY DINOSAURS disappeared! Just like gone. No death messages no anything they just vanished. I uninstalled the game and have no intent on playing it again. Also Troodon are really annoying.

To summerize: DON'T buy this game if you don't want to be VERY dissapointed. 
It would have had a huge potential, but the devs never cared about the balancing (high lvl players VS new ones and PVE issues) and thus it is unplayable due to the toxic community and not to mention the cheaters everywhere.
I have tried to play ARK many times, and sometimes even enjoyed it, but after 1K hours in it I cannot recommend it at all. 

Details read below:

The official PVE servers are so full of structures, that there is no place to build on them, literaly. Thus playing PVE is no option due to the fact that on these servers people will build these structures everywhere, so that you have no place to live and as you can't destroy these, there is no real place to make a base. And eventualy you WILL give up.
As a result you can only "try" the PVP servers.

The official PVP servers are toxic. 
This game so unbalanced, that you can get killed/hunted/farmed/griefed by Lvl 90+ players riding 200+ lvl dinos, even when you are lvl 1. There is no balance, no aid, no chance. NONE.

The "Mega clans" or so called "Alpha tribes" dominate the officical servers and if you are not in them or are "allowed" to exist by them, then you have no chance at all. Literaly none. AND they WILL hunt you, grief you, not let you live and farm you as they please. You have NO chance against them. NONE.
They do not just have way many more people then you, but are so much higher advanced, that you don't stand a chance, not matter what you do. You cannot build any base, as they will raid it, you cannot tame any dinos, as they will kill it, you cannot do ANYTHING, because they won't let you as this it "their" server. It is a total nonsense. AND the game supports this. Devs don't care and NEVER cared about it.

I have been a member of such a mega tribe before, seen how they dominate ARK, what and how they operate and what stuff and dinos they have, and believe me: you cannot imagine and don't stand any chance if you try to do anything. Most likely you will simply give up after the 60+ time raid by them. 

If you don't believe me and belive the "Very positive" recent reviews, then go ahead and give it a try. 
Eventualy you will come to the same conclusion that the time spent on this game was a big waste of time.

I am a 53 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

On my unofficial private server however, with heavily modified settings and a few mods, this game is wonderful. working together with your friends to tame and level creatures.

ARK is so sad because the theory behind it is nearly everything I want in a game. The exploration is fun, most everything is tamable as a mount or pet, multiplayer, PVE or PVP, etc. And I have genuinely enjoyed playing the game in some ways. 

HOWEVER:
As many big developers have been doing recently, they launched the game in early development, and a lot of actual gameplay hasnt changed since. There's new dinos, new maps, hell a NEW GAME, but they haven't polished some of the most frustrating and disappointing aspects of the game since day 1. The hit boxes are abysmal, animations are a let down, you can get stuck in cracks and crevices, almost everyone installs mods and changes settings drastically to make the game very playable, ESPECIALLY outside of PVP. Instead of releasing new money grab content it would be nice to see work put into making the game feel higher quality, be better optimized, and feel like a smoother, more immersive experience. They were so close but I wish someone else could take the IP and make it feel like a good quality game. I've stopped buying all of their products because its the same disappointment every time.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Edit*: This 100% a "look it up on google to work how it works game." There are no in game explanations. 

The game makes no effort to explain how saving works. And the dev's seem to have gone out of their way to make it obscurely complicated.  This is one of those games where you can expect to alt tab out a lot to Google what something is/does because know what your doing would be too handholdy I guess. 

Hints:
- If you run a local server, enable admin commands so you can use "admincheat saveworld" to save your game. You (and your mates) can exit the game safely after this because their character data is stored host side (with the world file I think?).
- If you want to transfer your character between worlds (i.e. load a new map but silly play Capt. Billy Strangler) you need to upload them at one of the big floating towers. Remember to transfer your items into "the transporter" first. Because the dev's figured that 'upload character' should mean upload only your character's stats and delete the items you spend hours grinding for.

This game is a tragic loss simulator.  You're a survivor among dinosaurs and other wild creatures, not to mention the other survivors around you.  You band together in hopes to keep what you spend many hours into creating and achieving, but whether it's due to native gameplay or random bugs in the code, you're always at risk to losing everything.  The devs try their best to keep the players happy, but this game was released and maintained in a broken state for all its years on the market.  I've dumped 1,646 hours into this game, only to be leaving it feeling like I've achieved nothing.  Those that have the will to maintain and keep going become desensitized, and feel the need to continue to bully the players which they come across, much like the game bullies each survivor with every turn at the corner. It's not healthy and it takes away from the true nature of life, teaching the wrong things to those that strive to learn everything about this game. I don't recommend playing it, albeit it is an experience to experience. We'll see how Ark 2 evolves, but I don't have my hopes up.

Got this game on sale for 10$. 25$ for the DLC's. 
MULTIPLAYER PVP : As a survival PVP game similar to Rust, I'd have to say it is bad, experienced tribes with massive bases, filled with members that seem to have unlimited time on their hands litter the best spots on the map. After a day or two, these guys control most of the high tier resources (metal, obsidian, artifacts, element), which can make the game increasingly frustrating when your base gets wiped while you were offline.
SOLO/MULTIPLAYER SURVIVAL : Playing this game in survival, especially with no prior knowledge, can be almost like a second Minecraft. Good graphics to back up the almost overwhelming amount of content, but a surprising amount of bugs and annoyances. It is quite easy to get stuck on funky hitboxes, or to have trouble turning with sometimes terrible dino turn radii (probably a skill issue on my part). Not sure if many other people experience this bug, but keep it in mind: while Ark is a fun game to play, be aware that there is a bug where the game decides to not load anything in your save file. The icon representing your "save" is still present, but your character, dinos, and builds are all wiped. It is just as if you started a brand new game, but you didn't. Overall, especially if this bug doesn't persist or gets fixed, great game.

The concept is amazing and the PvE side is fun especially with friends, but it is undeniably riddled with bugs that the developers don't care to address. Glitching and clipping on creatures, structures, and sometimes even the ground itself, frustrating building system with false visual snap points, and for a game focused a lot on its creatures, it has the most half-baked pathfinding AI. Most players choose to ignore the issues and give positive reviews because the game is still fun at its core, but the developers' lack of care for these since day one really makes you question their ability of making ARK 2 even good. 

I wouldn't recommend this game without quality of life mods such as structures plus, auto engrams and ultra stacks. Without a doubt, it's the modding community that's keeping this game alive.

Once my favorite game ever.  I returned to try the new content that's released since I stopped playing.  The game is amazing, the official servers are trash.  The additional stress this adds to an already stressful game is enough to make anyone quit.  The fact that this is still an issue this many years beyond launch is astounding.  Why aren't these devs working on a solution instead of pushing new events, adding dinos and maps?  Some servers go down about every 2 hours for 45 minutes, before they are rebooted.  Oh you were taming something?  Well that's unfortunate, I hope it wasn't something like a shadowmane that is already a cancer taming process.  

On top of that, EVERY server hard freezes every 15 minutes for 10-30 seconds.  What other games would you tolerate that in?  You wouldn't, and that's why this is so sad to me.  I love this game, but I hope they do better in the next one.

I am a 57 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 32 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

This is a long somewhat extensive review explaining several points.... the quality / state of the game, its development / enforcement team, history, and my personal opinion on it. More so a rant tbh but hope it helps you!

At the height is the graphic settings / memory leak. the game is ran on an old version of unreal engine, the game is not optimized its come a long way but there's still some aspects. IE Particles slider or something. so many times do i see people crash after they blow something up due to the dust particles that come up or tek bouncing in a suit, managarmr dust, gen water particles etc. If you got a good comp with proc youre good but even ppl with new gear still have issues sometimes. Most ppl who pvp tinker with a file called console variables / INI. that being said PVE wise the game is gorgeous af!!!!!!!!!!

For PVE i would highly recommend it. Specifically if you're new to the game or just buying it..... i would start off in single player for a bit, if you have friends to play with this is a warning to you about the official PVE servers. They can be more toxic than pvp. Examples: In this game people cannot build close to one another within a certain range, so tribes on pve will spam their foundations / increase their perimeter / block build spots  for newcomers or other tribes etc. They will drag dinosaurs that can destroy metal or soak turrets into your base just for fun. so join at your own risk there are servers that are not that toxic, there are also fresh servers sometimes. 

If you want pvp.... the current state of the game on official PVP servers as well as ARKPOK is riddled with EXPLOITERS DUPLICATION BUGS OR CLIENTS HACKERS AIMBOTTERS ESP REAL MONEY TRADING INSIDERS. i would recommend you joining unofficial servers that are populated and actively enforced. MTS is alright there has been occasional admin abuse but for most part atm it has been cleaned up last i heard. However it is a server where you will have to no life to keep up with everyone otherwise you can be offlined / wiped fast.
(That being said, you are subject to a random persons rules / ethic / moral Meta etc. In most cases admins of unofficial server abuse their admin role and spawn items/tames in for "bribes" or "personal" "friend" etc where as official you wont see that. now thats not every server of course)  

My unbiased opinion is that there is no other game like it...that is what makes it so great / sad at same time for pvp players. i have multiple accounts with total of around 20,000 + hours give or take a couple thousand being either afk or unaccounted for. ive played since alpha.

Unfortunately the PVE community is much bigger than the PVP so the developers will cater to them over PVP community, for the simple fact that the PVP community creates most the problems that devs have to spend resource on.... they will only do anything to fix certain things when they are put on blast by the entire community or reddit YT etc. IE HOD GAMING MESH REDDIT INCIDENT and Currently RAIL GUN HACKER EPIDEMIC....they have since removed the ability to use rail gun bc of hackers but prior to the epidemic the railguns purpose was to help raid caves for the cave meta or defend against meshers. meshing is the act of going into an area you are not intended to in the map ie under the map or inside of the mesh.... bypass another tribe/ players defenses and gain advantage by blowing up their stuff going inside their base / stealing etc. 

Enforcement is an absolute joke now, theres too many hackers to devote the time and resources to. i get it.. their job is limited bc their is so many ways to get around being banned or hardware id banned so its unfair to place the entire blame on them for the hacker side of things. theyre basically fighting a losing battle / 24/7 at this point due to the limited anticheat software. Theres tons of controversial topics on some of enforcement's choices in the past IE the og enforcement lead "Valor" leaving etc. i wont go into that. Oh and there are tribes who have "game testers" or friends with testers that get the first inside scoop on bugs / exploits to abuse before theyre patched!! cool right?

i will go into is the legal history of the 2 gaming companies that run the game. WildCard + Snail games. if you have ever seen the show "silicon valley" you will know that if company 1 uses company 2s facility/resources to build something to benefit company 1 without company 2 knowing, they are liable to legal repercussion. which is exactly what happened between the 2 (wild card or mother company and snail games). in this snail games owns/ operates a portion of the gaming service. IE official conquest / classic cluster and Pixark. They have since abused the cluster for their own personal advantage for a tribe that includes a player who's relations involve a exec in snailgames. whether or not this is entirely true is a blurr. the proof however lies in their actions towards said tribe / history of said tribe. insider information etc... The tribe being referred to can cheat with amnesty given...if you raid them and beat them more often than not they will cry to a enforcement member they have under their payroll / finger to unban and then ban all the attackers....or they will just cheat towards your tribe... leaving an unfair advantage over other tribes. there so much history to go over about said tribe but i will not go into any more. you can find videos on YT if you would like to learn more. just search hod gaming wipes cheating tribe. 

PVP has had its ups and its downs with metas, theres so many niches and tames to choose from to kill people with.. its great to have a arsenal to choose from. That being said most ppl just follow a meta. Personally for me the best point in time for this games meta history was the start of new servers. Had around the Most active players on official pvp, (255 ping and 20fps was truely still awful looking back xD but 255 ping still happens on wide scale pvp) asia was still open to fight with dinosaurs werent completely bred to hell to the point where they 1 tap players or other dinosaurs. There wasnt these op dinosaurs to soak turret bullets with. it was pretty level playing field on foot pvp as well. there was actually bases above ground. now the game has progressed from a simple dinosaur / primitive buildup on land game, to a futuristic mythological cluster F of rats in caves. Tek grenade launchers Flamethrower bobs mind control  flying space dolphins with laser beams / whales with laser cannons hawk that saves your items if someone kills you also allowing you to just kys whenever someone shows up to kill you and get the satisfaction of looting the kill. Giant monsters kaijus dragons griffs weird little alien fish wolf (shadowmane)  Theres so much ridiculousness now...that being said it is refreshing to have new dinos / items. 

To wrap up this rant, to any new players......i love and hate this game.....for me i am done due to the state of the pvp community / meta hacker epidemic etc and i have given enough time to the game and its time to wait for ark 2 release as well as bordom........

I wouldnt currently recommend this to my worst enemy, unless they were very open about ball smash torture being a fetish.  Anyway, When I first saw this game I was so amazed at the concept of it and I watched videos for days.  I finally purchased it and absolutely fell in love.  Once I was able to play the game for myself,  I couldnt believe how much fun it was.  I have I think 3000 hours on xbox and then moved here when I got a pc and have 316 hours.  This game is definitely one of the funnest experiences ive ever had and all of that is RUINED by rampant CHEATING.  I dont think i've played another game with this much cheating before.  You've got people duplicating items, which also ends up shutting the servers down for everyone and they end up rolling the servers back 15 mins, and you better just pray you weren't fighting something or flying or doing something dangerous 15 mins ago cause you will load back in and fall to your death/be killed by whatever your fighting.  On top of that the amount of Real World Trading that goes on, (Selling in game Dinos, items, WHOLE BASES/Locations) on the public servers is insane.  You almost need a group of 50 friends to combat some of these cheap tactics, but even then when the cheaters are exploiting Railguns and can shoot you through walls from 97867659698 yards away so thats just 50 targets for them to practice on. Dont even get me started on the amount of players meshing their bases into the walls/floors of the map so you literally cant raid them properly.  If you would like to see a nice overview of some of the cheats check out H.O.D. Gaming on youtube, he has consistently been one of the most entertaining/helpful producers of ark pvp content for years and hes done a nice video about the cheating, that being said, once Wildcard actually shows an effort to support their existing game and bans the cheaters/infiltrates all the RWT facebook/other social groups and shuts them down  instead of focusing solely on Ark 2 then I will revise my review and remove all the cheating talk from my thoughts while reviewing.

It's hard to put to words exactly what ARK has been to me. I was obsessed with dinosaurs as a kid, so when my buddy told me about a new early-access survival game with dinosaurs, I was immediately sold. 10,000 hours later I can say that ARK - even with all it's numerous bugs and frustrations - has provided me more enjoyment than probably every other game I've ever played [i]combined[/i]. It's not without it's flaws, as I mentioned, and those honestly gave me more frustration than every other game I've played combined as well, but in the end, the allure of the creatures, the taming, breeding, exploring, and most of all building always brought me back. I finally reinstalled one last time (quite the ordeal since the game along with a normal amount of essential mods and the expansion maps takes up around 300 terabytes of disk space) to cross the 10k mark and get the last couple achievements I somehow missed, and now I can finally retire and [b]finally[/b] click "yes" to recommend this game to other players.
 
If I could start over from the beginning, I absolutely would. If anyone out there [i]hasn't[/i] experienced ARK, you're in for a massive, deep, time-consuming ride.

PROS:
massive creature variety,  taming, riding, and breeding creatures, amazing landscapes, challenging caves and bosses, unexpectedly immersive story (from vanilla ark to Genesis 2) with hidden lore around the world, creative building (aided by mods) and on a related note, a [b]substantial[/b] community of modders that flesh out an already massive game. 

CONS:
Bugs. Every game has them, this one is no different. More frustrating than that is human nature though - the survival genre attracts aggressive trolls, and your far more likely to be ganked or wake up to your base exploded than you are to experience gratifying world-PvP. PvE exists of course, but simply doesn't provide enough challenge to warrant continued breeding and building, which were my main long-term goals in game.

Well; I decided to dive into this game when it first released to alpha, and I've also come back to play it when they've added tek, adobe, and a host of other things.

I want to like this game, I really do. I try to like this game, which is why I play it with friends, but every single day there is something with this game that aggravates our group.

Bugs out the rear end to start. Even some known bug where the game will freeze if a wireless headset disconnects. The game will just completely become unresponsive and has to be restarted. I decided to look online, and there's a slew of other people with the issue, most of them unable to fix the issue. One guy even had to purchase a wired headset to circumvent the issue. 

Performance has gotten better since the alpha, but there's things with the engine this game runs on that make it unimpressive. Things like light-bleeding inside of structures when you place lights down. The developers also had some huge obsession with bloom, because it's everywhere. I had to utilize console commands in order to remove the bloom completely and not make it look like crap. At some points I felt like I needed to genuinely wear a pair of sunglasses when I play. If you really want to blind your friends, use the flair-gun. Guarantee they'll yell at you.

I've played all the maps; and the first few offered nothing special. They all were just maps with grass, and snow. Then the developers decided to get kinky and add a volcano. Fjordur and The Center are the only two maps where I felt like they tried to add variety.  I also do enjoy the massive desert biome in Ragnarok. 

Also not too impressed with the "Paint" functionality in this game. I come from 7 Days to Die, and those developers did painting functionality where it was easy to use, and you didn't dread it. If you use a paint brush and you have a decent size building; then be prepared to scream and want to throw yourself off a cliff. It's the most painful and tedious task ever in this game.

I wasn't impressed with the build limit either. I noticed a lot of other players were also complaining about this on the servers I tried. Unofficial servers can raise / modify the limit, but as far as official servers; not impressed one bit with this. For a game with SO many assets, the limit seems very low-balled.

If you want to have fun, it's definitely a game to try. But be prepared to get annoyed as time goes on. 

I recently heard that they are developing Ark 2; which is quite puzzling, considering the fact that Ark 1 doesn't even look like a completely finished product. Now they're going off to the next money grab. Hopefully it's polished this time around.

*Spoilers Alert- If you don't want to read this whole review, I highly recommend this game!

I got this game when it was on sale for 100% off one time (a few months ago from when this review is posted), and decided to try it out... I already had a love for dinosaurs for my whole life, and knew a lot about them, so this game seemed right up my alley, and it is! I have been having so much fun playing this game, there is just so much to do in each and every map! And sure, you can get annoyed at times from things like a raptor killing you over and over again when you first start, or if you get killed by piranhas when trying to cross a river- and then try to get your stuff back from the river and just keep getting killed over and over again, but once you eventually find a way to play, you will have so much fun! And the taming part is definitely my favourite part about this game, being able to tame a powerful creature that has previously terrorized you, or just for fun is just such an amazing feeling! I remember a time when I was just starting and got attacked by a carno, and I only had tranq arrows on me so I just kept running away and shooting it with those until it eventually got knocked out... so I just gave it some food and I tamed it! I absolutely recommend this game to anyone with a love for dinosaurs, animals, survival, building, exploring, etc.!!!

Ark is really only fun on unofficial PvE (personal server, solo, or some random community server.) for the most part if you don't take fun in taming dinos and building small settlements with others this game isn't for you, simple as that. 

On the other hand is PvP.... Official PvP is a mess of glitches, hacks, and whatever else people can slip through with to turn your hours of play into nothing more than smoke and ashes, If you go onto Youtube rn and look up meshing you will get plenty off 60 second videos of some rat clipping through reality and either raiding a legit player or building a base so impossibly good they can raise a family of 86 without a single one being disturbed. Sometimes they also live in their own little rat communities creating whole villages in the fabric of space and time. My point being Its awful garbage the devs don't care about.

On the final other other hand is Non-Official PvP it can be fun depending on your style and how good the server owners are, I personally prefer the PvP where you rp with eachother not to be mean spirited just compete. This way you won't get your thatch hut nuked but when you build your tek castle you have to use diplomacy and war since others want your crown.

All in all 8/10 game I hope Ark2 has more PvE focus since well PvP is a joke

one of the best games i have ever played, it takes awhile to learn/master and a lot of grinding to actually progress far in the game. yet every aspect of the game is enjoyable and rewarding whether its taming and breeding creatures, exploring the many maps, caving, gathering resources, or making an attempt at fighting one of the bosses. Two things I will mention as downsides are 1. the game is very large and with all DLCs im actually pretty confident it is the largest game and 2. the building system is not the best, the snap points some structures seem very strange, and i have had some structures break for practicly no reason (example:recently i built a bridge connecting two buildings together then i placed a wall on part of one of the buildings but picked it up because i did not like it and then the entire bridge broke) yet it is still possible to make very large detailed buildings just very tedious. yet exluding these two aspects the base game provides hours of amazing play time then adding the DLCs it provides you with even more, with over 1,000 hours on PC a little more on the ps4 the game dosent get old and i havent even gotten around to beating the bosses on some of the maps yet. I strongly recommend this game to everyone even just to check it out running around with no tools on the beach can be fun with a couple friends and the game goes on sale for really cheap ocasionally.

i have played this for a few day straight now,and the game is very fun and addictive.
there are just a few problem in this game,mostly its AI,and spawning problems.
first of all what i find a problem is that some dodo's only take one arrow to kill,while others take like 5-6.
it lacks a bit of consistency here.
everybody knows about the raptor problem,running around like some killing machine.
sometimes they nicely stay in one area other times,there run like crazy and spot you from miles away.
sometime i get this feeling animals are spawned in just to annoy me.
or only attack me and nothing else.
now the biggest problem with the raptor is the jump glitch,where it jumps on you,and you end up inside the raptor,not being able to move.
this should have been fixed ages ago.
also some servers forced my running speed too 130% this is unacceptable in my eyes.
i want to spend those points myself.
so i log back in,and i can only carry half the weight,i selected.
resource gathering is also big problem,some servers have boosted it way to high.
and normal is too low.
so you swing you axe one time,and you weight capacity is full.
the whistle wheel is missing an aggressive stance.
how ever if i whistle neutral all,i need to manually reset all my dino's.
so setting up dinos is hard,if you want them to protect your base in pvp.
a lot of times dinos get stuck behind rocks and trees,mostly when 2 trees are too close.
so you have to walk all the way back to go get them/keep an eye on the constatly.
the path finding system is a straight line,or an area,it does not try to find ways around things.
and generally feel like ever 5 meter has a spawn point for something that is out to kill you.
just a little too much....in my mind.
while other areas feel almost feel abandoned.

Spawn into an easy zone, get immediately killed by an alpha raptor. 

Respawn, start building a base with a friend. Upgrading armor, weapons, and defenses. Things going well. 

Go out to explore and get hide, alpha raptor kills us and then glitches in a loop on our corpses. Approaching it and it insta-kills us. 

Ok, cool, lure it away in a steady string of corpses until we can recover our gear from the first death. 

Back at the base things are going well. We got walls, defense, still upgrading gear. 

Alpha raptor attacks, destroys everything, glitches inside our house and is stuck. All our stuff is lost. 

Super fun game /s 


TLDR: Don't buy this game. It's buggy as hell.
If you want smooth gameplay, this game is not for you. It's really clunky.

***PLEASE READ TO THE END***

The game itself is the most amazing thing, and I have been playing video games since the advent of video games! Played this one since day one of early access, and still love it! 
All 6100 hours of it.
IF you want to play single player, or set-up/rent a private server, you will find thousands of hours of enjoyment in it.  From the survival aspect all the way to having tamed pet dinosaurs and other extinct, and some fictional animals, as well as worthy endgame goals and bosses. Many different maps to play on as well as the ability to link maps together in a cluster, and switch map to map with all of your possessions.
BRAVO!!
The workshop has tons of awesome mods that you can enhance all aspects of the game with and have an amazing experience.

However...

...The official servers are the biggest FLAMING TRASH HEAP I have ever experienced.
Wildcard studios has continually tries to address all of the cheating and exploits in the game and on their servers.
But they let it get too out of control.  Nothing they do makes any difference anymore.

Their (official) servers (PVE and PVP) are literal CANCER.

PVE is nothing but unskilled players clogging up the maps with Walmart style boxes for bases, not allowing free movement or suitable places to have your own base/structure. Most players only log in to keep their stuff from de-spawning, rendering it unplayable.
PVP has mega tribes that exploit every aspect they can, including map exploits and the ability to acquire end game items through a black market system involving real money.
You WILL get wiped.  No question about it.

The negative review is based in the official server side of the game, and should only be considered relevant if you want to play on official servers.  Other than that, go for it!
Singleplayer or private server with friends is the way to go!

I've played thousands of hours on the ps4 version, but coming to pc didn't change much outside of the ability to use mods. Not complaining really, I just kind of figured it would be a little further along. I play almost exclusively solo, and I will say that the solo game is limited in terms of endgame unless you want to give yourself near god mode stats in order to fight bosses. Bosses are a whole ordeal just to get to fight them, and even then most if not all of the tames you bring with are going to die. Beating the bosses is the only way, aside from mods of course, to access endgame resources and gear. That said, I've had a ton of fun in this game, even if the only time I've ever had tech equipment was the time I essentially cheated to get it. If that doesn't bother you, or if you have no problem playing online, great, go for it! The other thing to keep in mind is that most PVE maps have limited resources and land available, so if you want a better shot at being able to build you'll need to go solo or PVP, which means you put up with the PVP crowd which can be pretty aggressive even if you say you're friendly.

This game will consume your life and make you antisocial. The only reason I was able to find a relationship was because my console broke a few years back and I couldnt play ark. Now here I am engaged ONLY because I had to stop playing ark. This game takes over every fiber of your being therefore I recommend it %100!

Short review:
I have almost 7000 hours on record for this game. It has dinosaurs, that you can ride. Enough said.

Long review:
It's horribly addictive, entirely due to the fact it's "always online". It's a great game, don't get me wrong, but because it's an online game, you'll always have to consider the safety of your base and tamed animals.
If you play PvE, you'll only have to worry about the natural decay of your structures and tamed animals (they will despawn from the game world, if you haven't been near them for several days)
If you play on a PvP server, however, you'll have to worry about other players possibly "raiding" your little scrub base, while you're sleeping or off at work. If you play the game long enough, you'll learn to determine when an enemy base's players are probably not online, meaning you can more or less safely work your way through their defenses. So if it's your base, you'll come back in the morning or after work, and find your base gone, your character dead, and probably all of your tamed animals horribly murdered.
The only way to properly play on a PvP server, without losing sleep that is, is to join a "mega-tribe", a tribe so large, that there's always members online at some point in the day (or night) that will defend your collective work from aggressors.
In short, you either get destroyed while playing solo, or need to play with many other people in a large tribe, if you want to play on a PvP server.
Then you might ask yourself, why would you want to play on a PvP server? Because it's obviously how the game was intended to be played.
Many, MANY animals, items, and structures are clearly intended for PvP purposes. I won't even start to list and explain them.
But PvE servers are also very passive-aggressive.
Not only because you cannot destroy another player's base on a PvE server, but also because there's anti-grief mechanics on the PvE servers, so you cannot place structures too close to another player's structures, it means there's this passive-aggressive stalemate between people, playing a single crate or wooden pillar next to your base, in order to prevent you from expanding further, because they think you've already taken up too much space of "theirs". You can report them, and GM's are fortunately fast at responding to these things, but impotent drama of it all just makes me sick. Therefore, PvP servers are the optimal, and frankly in my opinion, only way to play the game.
I still recommend it though, because it's an amazing experience, once you've gotten the hang of it, and you've tried a few large-scale tribe wars. Yes, wars. With 30-40 Vs. 30-40 players duking it out with massive Giganotosaurus dinosaurs, flying dragons, laser-guns, and other crazy stuff.
Buy it and give it a try, currently only 17 Euro, which isn't much for a game I've spent nearly a year playing, every day.

Before the Chinese took over this game, it was incredibly boring. All of the servers were super active, which meant there was never much "alone" time, to really enjoy the peace and quiet the island had to offer. There were always people online, talking, trading, killing one another, or creating long-lasting friendships. That part alone was extremely obnoxious, and not at all what mass-multiplayer open world survival games are about.

Before the Chinese, I frequently survived for way too long. Sometimes so long that I ended up experiencing parts of the game that really shouldn't be experienced. See, the only part of the game that is really enjoyable is picking fiber with my bare hands, and the Chinese make it possible for me to repeat this process every single day, two days at the very latest. Pre-China, I made it all the way to a metal base, and let me tell you, it was hideous. After the first six dozen times that the Chinese demolished my metal base and turrets, I realized I'm more into boho theme. Thatch and wood are more stylish.

To me, nothing is more fun than repeating the first 15 minutes of the game, anything past that you start to realize how stale the game is. The Chinese swoop in and ensure that you get to re-experience the most thrilling parts of what the game has to offer.

I would recommend ARK only in 1 specific case – you have a group of friends and will play on a private/local server. You get to enjoy the game at your own pace, with modified server multipliers, without the worry of PvP and server-dominating tribes. Graphics are great, the world is beautiful, lots of cool dinos to tame. There’s a lot to do, to build, to explore, to figure out.

But playing on a large PvP server is horrible experience. You are at a mercy of alpha tribes that have everything and can do anything. Slow progression, server wipes, laggy combat, so much grinding to catch up just to have your base destroyed while offline. Maybe you could find some servers where all this is more balanced but even then, it just becomes a game of who can grind more. It’s just not something I would ever recommend.

I have played this game for a very long time since it was first released on Xbox. In total between Xbox and steam I’ve put a little over 6000 hours into this game. I do love ark and the game has a lot of potential, but I do not recommend it.

The game has serious issues that the dev’s don’t seem to care about because after years they never get addressed. While playing on official pvp servers you will run into people who mesh through the map which is incredibly easy to do. They can wipe your base without being shot by your turrets, attacked by your Dino’s, or hit by your character in anyway. 

Not only is meshing a huge issue but there are tons of hackers. Thousands of players using third party software like aimbot, wall hacks, speed hacks, and general esp. trust me it’s disgusting and no fun to play against whatsoever. 

The dev’s have been aware of these problems for years and they don’t do anything about it. For a live service game that is always online in real time there is LITTLE TO NO SUPPORT FROM THE DEV’S. They made their money from the game and now are focused on ark 2. Which I am not looking forward to since they never fixed any of these issues on the first game I doubt the second game will be any better.

In short I do like playing this game and it’s been a lot of fun at times however it has way to many issues. I have since stopped playing this game and will never recommend it to anyone nor will I be buying ark 2.

5369.9 hours and I ran into every single type of thing that ruins the game. 
1. Players forcing mutations in official and unofficial coding in 8 billion mutations.
2. Code-logging(spoofing) another players account in a server that's being tracked in Battlemetrics.
3. ESP or aimbotting with esp using railguns and/or blatantly cheating with every admin privilege.
4. While raiding and making fobs the cheater somehow locks that official server from downloads? How the crap do they not get automatically banned...
5. Mesh building... Enough said.
Lastly please give more than 3 defensive turrets, why is that so hard. Raiding is so easy to the point where having a base means nothing. No one can enjoy having stuff with these terrible defenses, base locations or "hidden holes." It takes 0 effort for someone to just throw a turtle or a stego with 8 billion mutations and perfect stats and soak someones base offline.

When i first played this game it gave me the sense of wonder and exploration about what i would find around the next corner. The sense of danger and no idea what i would find next gave me that same sense of exploration that i hadn't encountered since player vanilla World of Warcraft many years ago. I know this game is very different in terms of its game loop but its the only game i found that scratched that itch.

The game loop is satisfying and has countless hours of replay ability despite a few bugs that add to the charm. After you start adding mods to this game its even better! 

Highly recommend 10/10

After reporting multiple cheaters, dupers, hacking discords everything ive come to realise that it doesnt matter because they do not care. Official servers are filled with hackers and unplayable. Your account gets hacked if you mess with the wrong people and no matter what you say or do , wildcard doesnt care.

Youtubers have finally spoke out against the devs and wildcard. 
The pvp community is dead, official is unplayable and this game doesnt have the right devteam to back up its potential.

After Playing for nearly 1000 hours I've encountered most the game has to offer, from the spawn camping Rex on a beach to killing all of the endgame bosses on each map. Through all of the bugs in the game from having the mesh swallow your dino and character to wildcard breaking servers and deleting all of your progress on their servers. Yes the game is a buggy mess and has a lot of downsides but the community is great, there is a reason so many maps in the game are ported from mods and that the community is still playing the game regularly to this day. It's a difficult grind and consumes a lot of time, but if you enjoy sandbox games where you can do what you want then I fully recommend getting it, but it will definitely test your patience. Also, if you want to play PVP prepared to be more paranoid than any tryhard Rust server you've ever been on.

Please note this review is by a SINGLE-PLAYER perspective who ran this game using bootcamp (windows on mac) on an i5 with 8 ram. Sometimes it runs perfectly, sometimes it has to load overnight. Weirdly inconsistent. 

I loved it. I like the maps, I like the gear, the amount of control you have over the stats of your server, the way the weather and environment works. I like the look of the environment and the animals (player is…weird looking but fine) 

All this said, grinding to do bosses is a pain on singleplayer. The challenges to get the articacts are CONSIDERABLY harder than the boss fights them selves with some exceptions (assuming you don’t try and use wyverns…and then have no dinos in the fight). 

In general grinding to get the best gear is a nuisance even with increased rates. It gets a little unnecessarily complicated in my personal opinion. 

Still, love the game. What little I don’t love can mostly be fixed with settings, the extensive workshop, or cheats.

The game is plagued with bugs that have at best, a solution that takes 2 hours of research and at worst literally no fix. Excusable if they were small bugs but instead its things such as a boat that might be your base can get stuck on an invisible wall make you completely stranded, or eels that literally phase through walls and the very ocean floor itself while also stunning you, i cant recommend you buy this game simply because you would be throwing that money at devs who dont care to ever fix the problems with game, they will instead roll out a dlc or another unfinished, buggy, mess of a game.

This is a MMO past its time. Play with your friends, but not strangers. Online community is toxic.
Despite the option to play 1P, it is not a single player game. The difficulty does not scale down to what 1P is going to spend time doing. Late game equipment will have you grinding for hours. That combined with item durability degrade over time means you'll be grinding those resources all over again to fix your gear after only a couple of battles. Your tames, that you've spent days leveling will get permanently stuck on bad terrarain, accidentally murdered en masse trying to teleport to a boss fight, or butchered by the random Alpha variant of wild dino. You're going to have a bad time.

That is unless you unlock the in-game cheat menu and just hack your way to God-mode, resources, equipment, dinosaurs, exp.... But after that buzz wears off, there's not much point left to the game.

I dislike the crafting system as well, as the points you get from leveling aren't nearly enough to unlock recipes for what you need. All in all, if you want a good dinosaur survival game, don't get this one.

I have enjoyed playing Ark over the years, especially playing with friends and family. I would recommend to others, even if you prefer to play alone. It is a great sandbox game.

Ark's depth and variety is incredibly surprising. Between the expansions and mods there are hundreds of hours of play even at the casual level. The customizing options let you make the game as challenging or not as you want. In some ways the gameplay has a lot in common with Minecraft in that the kind of game you play is really up top you.  Some people like to push to endgame Tek and defeat all the bosses, while others stick to primitive play, collect dinos, or build extensive structures.  It's an incredible amount of content for the price, and well worth checking out.

This is the only game I can honestly say, I wish I had never heard of it. There is so much potential here, I've been playing for years, but ultimately, it's unplayable. Unless the AI is intentionally set to kill and destroy all players and their builds, it's fundamentally broken. I only play singleplayer because this game's players have a reputation similar to GTA players. 

Here's a quick description of how the game always plays: First 6 hours, repeatedly killed without time to gather resources until you've leveled up enough. Next 6 hours: Grind and gather resources as you excitedly finally get to play. Suddenly: A nonsensical event will take place like a giant whale in a shallow lake or an alpha carno stupidly overpowered will not only kill you, but destroy everything you've built, making you feel like you've just spent hours for nothing at all. If you happen to luckily respawn nearby after the event has "randomly" destroyed all your beds, the container bags will all glitch and you will loose everything without the decay bags appearing. 

The devs of this game have spent zero effort on balance. Building games are an art form that take skill to balance properly, this game has nothing like that. It's beautiful, dinos can be fun, but overall, there are better games will better payoffs out there. Since I discovered Conan, I stopped playing Ark altogether, but came back to try again. It's just a shame that this game was so badly managed.

Personally, I absolutely ADORE this game very much, including all of the unique dinosaurs in it. They are all different and even have their own attacks and dossiers! I love everything but one thing (more of a like for the thing that I'm about to explain) about this game. A minimal amount of the dinosaurs have actually gotten new skin textures or new animations. but what about the others? So many new dinosaurs have been added, but what about the classics? Sure the Raptors, Argentavises, Mammoths, Stegosaurs(...etc) have gotten TLCs, why not others? Lots of people have suggestions, like me! For example, I personally think that the Dilophosaurus, Gigantosaurus, or the Brontosaurus all should have their own TLCs. Anyhow, that's my review.

Engaging as flip. Survival grind to start, quickly levelling up once a rideable creature is tamed. Exploration of the map is somewhat essential to find certain resources and creatures better bred for specific roles. 
A great community and with mod-creators galore make this an extremely engaging and fulfilling game to play years after release! There are some bugs and graphics/model meshing can leave a little to be desired but the game still more than makes up for this with the possibilities and communal spirit. Whether maintaining a primitive play-through or rearming a Tek fortress whilst breeding your army of *insert fearsome creature of choice here* or stretching your coding skills in developing your own map/mod, Ark can show you another level of involvement and I encourage all to try it, especially with a tribe!

I decided to review this game after 1500 hours played. In one word: meh. 

The content is pretty good, lots of stuff to do, creatures to tame, breeding mechanics, while very grindy, are second to none. But that's basically all that is good about it. The game is eons old and it's still very very glitchy. Game breaking glitches like getting stuck onto creatures that are attacking you, your character dying for meshing when you're simply close to a wall or rock, full character wipe while teleporting. Etc. I've had situations where I spent months working on a good breed line, raised a full imprinted creature, crafted the best saddle, only for it to be one shot by a lesser creature in a dumb alpha mission in Genesis 2. 

Long story short - don't waste your time. The game isn't good. The developer does not care about player reports, does not police their official servers at all. It's plain and simple a cash grab.

I [i]really, really, really[/i] wanted to like ARK. It's survival mechanics aren't totally awful and can even be tuned to how you want, the progression doesn't feel awfully slow, the dinosaurs are fun as hell, base building (while extremely limited in certain cases) can be enjoyable and even relaxing. 

There are far too many bugs in a supposedly finished game to be excusable. The performance is one of the worst in gaming and that is not the fault of the rig it is the fault of awful optimisation. Multiplayer is a dead concept to me personally because of either cheaters or the influx of a clan of f*ckheads raiding everybody and teabagging them and deleting hours of progress, so sticking to a private server or just singleplayer is the way to avoid a massive headache. The devs are a joke, releasing paid DLC content before the launch out of early access and dedicating time away from actually making the game functionally enjoyable into other endeavours to moneygrab as much as possible.

Over 250GB download and install? Because you refuse to optimise your game?

F*ck off.

[b] Pros [/b]
- Dino hunting/taming game simulator for dino lovers
- Open world exploration (caves, bosses, wildlife & lore)
- Long term content meaning the lore and content take time to be completed (requiring you to acquire good tames to fight 
  bosses to proceed with the lore that connects from many different maps including DLC maps, may take like months)
- DLCs are not priority if you prefer vanilla but if you wish for more lore and content then DLC your way
- Plenty of servers to pick from (Officials and 3rd Party Servers/Host your own)
- If you love challenges, know the fact that even with endgame stuff, you are not invisible. You can still die very easily

[b] Cons [/b]
- If you play on Official, you may struggle trying to find a good spot to build (Beginners love to build on flat land but its 99% taken)
- Every structures have decay time ranging from weeks to months if you stay offline for too long you gonna lose everything
- Beginners gonna struggle a lot trying to not die here because dying is like 90% if you don't have a safe place to respawn
- If you died, all your items will decay in 30/25 mins so make sure you act fast if you have precious stuff in your inventory
- Buggy at times, your tame might just clip into the ground and die or be out of render distance and die or you die
- On Officials (its all I play) you will experience frequent server lag from time to time (reasons could be server saves or players exploiting duping methods)
- If you hate challenges, know the fact that even with endgame stuff, you are not invisible. You can still die very easily
- Momentum in this game sometimes can lead to your own death (jump near a slope and you will gain momentum to your death without bhop)
- If your tame dies, there's no reviving it ever
- You can get very op tames but if you encounter wrong enemy, you will lose everything so bare that in mind
- Breeding takes quite some time and you have to give constant care if you don't have a Maewing (you will know if you google)

There are a lot of things that I love about Ark. Great lore, interesting worlds.
But the game itself is so so poorly optimised. In general this is hard to work with but in the Gen1/2 maps some of the missions require really finicky handling that is largely not possible with the lag and rubber banding. That is on my own private server which has a low population... It's even worse on the official network.

I sometimes wonder whether the devs actually play their own game on the official network or just on super powered private clusters in their office. Because the mechanics of some of the missions are janky as hell. My entire community got sick of the missions and either quit the game, or i helped them cheat through them.

The official networks PVE are a wasteland of pillars that WC do nothing about. PVP official is full of cheaters. GM enforcement on servers is virtually non-existant. Having played both official PVE and unofficial PVE I would recommend avoiding the official network entirely.

Many many long term bugs that go all the way back to the early access days that remain unfixed. SP worlds resources not respawning. Dinos and/or players not respawning outside after a boss battle. Are some examples.

Oversights and lack of attention to detail. "Berries" in the game are all the same colour and are actually "cantaloupe". For years the AB Dimorphodon gave birth to normal dimo eggs. Like sure these might seem like small petty things... But they add up and after you see this time after time it begins to change your perspective of the game.

Mod handling by the game is pretty poor. People frequently start their SP games after a mod update to find that their world loaded without one of the mods they were using previously. I have played games that warn and prevent you from loading a save like that and allow you a chance to fix the issue before retrying. The same issue can happen on servers but is rarer... Still though the server should be able to detect its missing a mod and ask what to do.

On the topic of servers the amount of logging available is pitiful. There is very little actionable intelligence on whats occurring in the world to help admins with troubleshooting or enforcement activities.

The server transfer menu in game for unofficial clusters relies on the steam public servers listing filtered down to those with the same cluster ID as your current server. This is a PITA for those who may have issues publishing to steam or otherwise only want a LAN only cluster. The transfer menu should allow you access to LAN and favourites filtered lists so that you can access additional servers.
